<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">

    <catalog>hdl</catalog>

  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>

  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770202721</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Romeo! Why Do You Have to Be a Doggone Montague?</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Romeo! Warum müssen Sie ein verdammt 
Montague sein?</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Romeo ! Pourquoi devez-vous être nom de 
dieu un Montague ?</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Romeo! Por que você tem que ser doggone um 
Montague?</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Romeo! Perchè dovete essere doggone un 
Montague?</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Romeo! Γιατί πρέπει να είστε ένα Doggone 
Montague;</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">¡Romeo! ¿Por qué usted tiene que ser 
doggone un Montague?</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Students will interpret and comprehend Shakespeare's "Romeo and Juliet," Act 2, Scene 2 (the balcony scene) through translating the original text and preparing a dramatic presentation of the scene for the class.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Kursteilnehmer deuten und begreifen Shakespeares "Romeo 
und Juliet," Tat 2, Szene 2 (die Balkonszene) durch das Übersetzen 
des ursprünglichen Textes und das Vorbereiten einer drastischen 
Darstellung der Szene für die Kategorie.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les étudiants interpréteront et comprendront Romeo et 
Juliet de Shakespeare "," l'acte 2, la scène 2 (la scène de balcon) 
en traduisant le texte initial et en préparant une présentation 
excessive de la scène pour la classe.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Os estudantes interpretarão e compreenderão Romeo e 
Juliet de Shakespeare "," o ato 2, cena 2 (a cena do balcão) com 
traduzir o texto original e preparar uma apresentação dramática da 
cena para a classe.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Gli allievi interpreteranno e comprenderanno Romeo e 
Juliet dello Shakespeare "," Legge 2, scena 2 (la scena del balcone) 
through la traduzione del testo originale e preparando una 
presentazione drammatica della scena per il codice categoria.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Οι σπουδαστές θα ερμηνεύσουν και θα κατανοήσουν 
Romeo και Juliet Shakespeare "," νόμος 2, σκηνή 2 (η σκηνή
μπαλκονιών) μέσω της μετάφρασης του αρχικού κειμένου και της 
προετοιμασίας μιας δραματικής παρουσίασης της σκηνής για την 
κλάση.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Los estudiantes interpretarán y comprenderán Romeo y 
Juliet de Shakespeare "," el acto 2, escena 2 (la escena del balcón) 
con traducir el texto original y la preparación de una presentación 
dramática de la escena para la clase.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Menschlichkeit</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Sciences humaines</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Studi umanistici</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ανθρωπότητες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Humanidad</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <lifeCycle>
          <contribute>

              <value>author</value>

        </lifeCycle>

        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>

    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>103505</entry>

      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>

        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/romeo-why-do-you-have-to-be-a-doggone-montague</uri>
